title: How to Use a Hand Mixer

steps.title: Read all the instructions that came with your hand mixture.
steps.content: Read all the instructions that came with your hand mixture. Reading the instructions is the base step of working with any device. Note that each machine has something different in it, though the basic method of working is same in all the devices. Read the manual that came with the device and you will be safe.

steps.title: Make sure that you do not let the machine cords, plug, or even the body to touch water.
steps.content: Make sure that you do not let the machine cords, plug, or even the body to touch water. When you are working in a kitchen, this is a common mistake that may happen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Do not let children touch this appliance as this can cause injuries.
steps.content: Do not let children touch this appliance as this can cause injuries.

steps.title: Avoid moving the parts constantly.
steps.content: Avoid moving the parts constantly. Try to keep those in a fixed spot which will reduce the risk of damage.

steps.title: Know the parts of the mixer.
steps.content: Know the parts of the mixer. A hand mixer has four major parts. They are: as on/off button, power burst button, mixer body button and bowl rest button. There is no separate button to attach the mixing items with your mixer. You will have to do that separately.

steps.title: See what attachments you have.
steps.content: See what attachments you have. Some common attachment options are flat beaters, straight wire beaters, single whisks, twisted wire beaters and dough hooks. Some of them may come as a gift with your hand mixer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Do not use the bowl rest option when the mixer is on.
steps.content: Do not use the bowl rest option when the mixer is on. It will damage your mixer.

steps.title: Keep your case on hand.
steps.content: Keep your case on hand. Most hand mixers come with a storing case. You need to clean and dry your mixer before you put it in the storing case.

steps.title: Make sure that the mixer is unplugged and the speed is on low before you insert the beaters.
steps.content: Make sure that the mixer is unplugged and the speed is on low before you insert the beaters.

steps.title: Plug the mixer using your cable to the socket.
steps.content: Plug the mixer using your cable to the socket. Also, it is time to place the beater into a bowl.

steps.title: Slowly use the speed control button to set your desired speed.
steps.content: Slowly use the speed control button to set your desired speed. Start with 1 and then slowly increase it to your desired speed.

steps.title: When you are done mixing, make sure to turn the speed down to low before you unplug the mixer.
steps.content: When you are done mixing, make sure to turn the speed down to low before you unplug the mixer.

steps.title: Unplug the mixer by pulling the cable off from the socket.
steps.content: Unplug the mixer by pulling the cable off from the socket.

steps.title: Eject the beater that you installed.
steps.content: Eject the beater that you installed. Each mixer has a different procedure of removing beaters. Read your manual to understand your method. Make sure that the speed is set to 0 before you try this step.

steps.title: Turn off and unplug the mixer from socket before you eject the attached items.
steps.content: Turn off and unplug the mixer from socket before you eject the attached items.

steps.title: Use hot and soapy water to clean the attachment first.
steps.content: Use hot and soapy water to clean the attachment first. Attachments will always be dirtier than the main mixer.

steps.title: Take a wet cloth and wipe the main mixer body.
steps.content: Take a wet cloth and wipe the main mixer body.

steps.title: Let the mixer dry and then put it in the storing box.
steps.content: Let the mixer dry and then put it in the storing box. [3] X Research source
